Incorrect text: The European Commi66ion said on Thursday it disagreed with German advice to consumers to shun Brifish ss ..ff lamb until scientists determine whether mad cow disease can be transmitted to sheep.
The corrected text is:
correct_text: The European Commission said on Thursday it disagreed with German advice to consumers to shun British lamb until scientists determine whether mad cow disease can be transmitted to sheep.
prediction:
German authorities advised Friday that the risk from the British BSE problem does not yet warrant changing any of your animal or pet feed. German veterinarians disagreed, however, with this advice. Dr. Rolf Becker of the Veterina­ristliche Institut (IV) Berlin said on Thursday that “the risk [of mad cow disease] is real. …

How does such OCR errors get through the filters I have set and how can we prevent their making it into print.

It's a pity they haven't posted this article already. The correction should be included in it, perhaps as an endnote.
– Michael SiveterNov 5 '13 at 9:24

I did include some comments I had prepared, and it would not be a major change, I hope. I also agree, that the proper response to any such problems (especially in books) ought to be, a) correction of all relevant issues in an errata note, and, of b) publication of a second volume to address any remaining (irregularities that cannot be so solved or else that could only be properly remedied in a second volume.) This is one instance in which "publish before you post", a good rule in the world of books, in general might seem a good idea (though not necessarily an immediate one.)
– Robert IsraelNov 11 '13 at 1:47<|endoftext|>
